trygit.name: Try Git
trygit.description: Use this short interactive introduction to Git to learn the fundamentals of the Git source code control system.

gitsimpleguide.name: Git - the simple guide
gitsimpleguide.description: Learn the basics of Git including workflows you'll come to rely on in your daily web development activities.

githubtraining.name: GitHub Training & Guide
githubtraining.description: Extend your understanding of Git and GitHub by Book the series of guides developed by the staff of GitHub.

githubhelloworld.name: GitHub Hello World
githubhelloworld.description: Build on your knowledge of Git and GitHub by using them to create and manage a Hello World application.

gitimmersion.name: Git Immersion
gitimmersion.description: Reinforce what you already know about Git as well as learning new techniques and workflows by using Git in this guided tour.

howtogitngithub.name: How to Use Git and GitHub
howtogitngithub.description: Gain an understanding of the basics of using source code control by learning the industrity standard tools - Git and GitHub.

ydkjsupngoing.name: You Don't Know JS: Up & Going
ydkjsupngoing.description: Learn the basics of the Javascript language to establish a firm foundation on your journey to becoming a Javascript developer.

ydkjsscope.name: You Don't Know JS: Scope & Closures
ydkjsscope.description: Having a thorough understanding of scopes and closures is key to being a good Javascript developer and a prerequiste before learning more advanced concepts.

ydkjsthis.name: You Don't Know JS: this & Object Prototypes
ydkjsthis.description: The concept of 'this' is one of the most confusing in Javascript. In this lesson you'll gain an understand of this and the object prototyping mechanism that make Javascript both unique and powerful.

cs50x.name: Introduction to Computer Science - CS50
cs50x.description: Join in Harvard Universities acclaimed Introduction to Computer Science course CS50!

learnhtmlcss.name: Learn to Code HTML & CSS
learnhtmlcss.description: Use this guide to learn the fundamental technologies and techniques of front end design and development using HTML and CSS.

onlineresume.name: Clone this online resume template
onlineresume.description: Practice your HTML and CSS skills by cloning an online resume template.
onlineresume.instructions: Using only HTML and CSS create a static webpage that is functionally equivalent to this online resume template.

ydkjstypes.name: You Don't Know JS: Types & Grammar
ydkjstypes.description: While Javascript is a dynamic language it is none-the-less important to understand how data is typed. In addition, it's always important to have a firm grasp of the rules, or grammar, that govern how Javascript works.

ydkjsasync.name: You Don't Know JS: Async & Performance
ydkjsasync.description: One way that modern applications achieve performance is by performing operations in parallel with one another. In this lesson you'll learn the techniques of asynchronous programming and how to benchmark and tune your applications.

ydkjses6.name: Book: You Don't Know JS: ES6 & Beyond
ydkjses6.description: While the history of Javascript is ECMAScript 5, it's future is ECMASCript 6. Learn how to take advantage of the benefits of ES6 in your applications.

advhtmlcss.name: Learn to Code Advanced HTML & CSS
advhtmlcss.description: Take a deep dive into to frontend design and development by learning the advanced HTML and CSS techniques you'll need in any Web Developer postion.

fccportfolio.name: Build FCC Personal Portfolio Webpage
fccportfolio.description: Build a personal porfolio to showcase your achievements.
fccportfolio.instructions: Complete the Portfolio project from the Frontend Certificate program on Freecodecamp.

projectspecdocs.name: Project Specification Documents
projectspecdocs.description: Learn how to read Project Specification Documents and get in the habit of including every bit of information it details that makes sense for a project in the README.md or other supporting documentation for your projects

ettmath.name: Effective Thinking Through Mathematics
ettmath.description: Learn how to employ mathematical strategies to problems and question. Use these techniques to gain insight and find innovative solutions.

setupes6.name: Setting Up ES6
setupes6.description: Learn how to setup Babel, the premier Javascript transpiler, so you can use ECMAScript 6 in your applications.

jsallonge6.name: JavaScript Allong√©, the "Six" Edition
jsallonge6.description: Learn how to program using functions in Javascript to write software that is simpler, cleaner, and less complicated than object-centric or code-centric approaches.

getsassy.name: Getting Sassy with Sass
getsassy.description: Learn about one of the most popular CSS preprocessors - SASS.

towersofhanoi.name: Towers of Hanoi
towersofhanoi.description: Build an online Towers of Hanoi solver
towersofhanoi.instructions: Your solution should accept a tower height between 5 and 10, and then display a graphical (animated) solution, iteratively moving each piece until the puzzle is solved

createcsstemp.name: Create Webpage Template
createcsstemp.instructions: Pick a template from here and create a new template with it as your inspiration (do not use it's assets)

systematicpd1.name: How to Code: Simple Data
systematicpd1.description: This lesson teaches a pragmatic and systematic approach to programming that is language independent, and therefore is applicably to whatever programming language you choose to work in.

systematicpd2.name: How to Code: Complex Data
systematicpd2.description: In this lesson you'll build on the methodology you learned in 'How to Code: Simple Data' to learn additional techniques for solving more complex problems.

systematicpd3.name: Software Construction: Data Abstraction
systematicpd3.description: In this lesson you'll gain an understanding of data abstraction and decomposition techniques necessary to design and construct large, complex applications

domenlightment.name: DOM Enlightenment
domenlightment.description: Whether you are using HTML, CSS, Sass, Less, React, or Angular an understanding of the DOM is needed to create responsive and well performing apps.

gulp.name: Create a Gulp Workflow
gulp.instructions: Create a Gulp script and incorporate it into your development process workflow.

fccsimon.name: Simon Game
fccsimon.description: Demonstrate your frontend webdev skills by developing your own Simon Game
fccsimon.instructions: Implement the Simon game from the Frontend Certificate program at Freecodecamp.

intromongodb.name: Introduction to MongoDB
intromongodb.description: Learn more about MongoDB using the MEAN stack.

fccbackend.name: FCC Backend Certification
fccbackend.description: The FCC Backend Certification - all projects, ignore the tutorials and just read the official docs if you want.

calculus1.name: Calculus One
calculus1.description: At it's core Calculus deals with how things change and is used across many different disciplines including not just Mathematics and Computer Science, but Engineering, Biology and Life Sciences, and Sociology, to name a few.

jsdesignpatterns.name: JavaScript Design Patterns
jsdesignpatterns.description: Patterns in Computer Science define reusable solutions encountered in a variety of problem you will be faced with as a Web Developer. Learning design patterns is key to deveoping quality apps in a shorter time frame.

clonelandingpage.name: Clone Landing Page
clonelandingpage.description: Exercise your frontend webdev HTML and CSS knowledge by cloning a landing page.
clonelandingpage.instructions: Create a clone of this landing page. Be sure to create your own code antand assets

csmaths.name: Mathematics for Computer Science
csmaths.description: In this lesson you'll gain an understanding of the fundamentals of Discrete Mathematics used in Computer Science and Engineering.

algnflowcharts.name: Algorithms and Flowcharts
algnflowcharts.description: Read this article to improve your understanding of algorithms and how to describe them using classical flowcharting techniques.

intropencil.name: Familiarize yourself with Pencil
intropencil.description: Familiarize yourself with Pencil ... start flowcharting complex portions of your code logic as part of your documentation

cloneadmintemp.name: Clone this administrative dashboard
cloneadmintemp.description: Exercise your skills by using a JS frontend library to clone a complex webpage
cloneadmintemp.instructions: Recreate this administrative dashboard using React, Angular, or Vue

thinkjava.name: Think Java - How to Think Like a Computer Scientist
thinkjava.description: Learn the basic concepts computer scientists understand and utilize to solve computing problems.

classicpuzzles.name: Complete all Classic Puzzles - Easy
classicpuzzles.description: Complete the Easy level Classic Puzzles
classicpuzzles.instructions: Solve all the easy-level puzzles on CodinGame using JavaScript

opendatastructs.name: Open Data Structures
opendatastructs.description: At their core application are tools for manipulating data. In this lesson learn the fundamental data structures used to manipulate data.

algorithms1.name: Course: Algorithms, Part I
algorithms1.description: Learn about elementary data structures, sorting, and searching algorithms.

algorithms2.name: Algorithms, Part II
algorithms2.description: Learn about graph and string processing algorithms.

codejam15q2.name: Google Code Jam Qualification Round 2
codejam15q2.description: Complete all challenges from Googles Code Jam 2015 Qualification Round 2
codejam15q2.instructions: Using Javascript complete qualification Round 2 of Google's Code Jam

clonefrontpage.name: Clone Website Front Page
clonefrontpage.description: Recreate the front page of this website
clonefrontpage.instructions: Using your own original code and assets recreate this websites front page, modifying it to highlight a different product or industry. Make special note of the secondary navigation bar at the top. Implementing that is the highlight of this project.

mobileuxdesign.name: UX Design for Mobile Developers
mobileuxdesign.description: The smaller form factor of many mobile devices make them unique and sometimes challenging to develop for. Use this resource to learn how to effectively exploit the user experience of your apps for these devices.

androiddev.name: Android Development for Beginners
androiddev.description: Learn the basics of Android development.

fccpomodoro.name: Build an Android Pomodoro Clock
fccpomodoro.description: Demonstrate your knowledge and skill by developing a Android Pomodoro clock
fccpomodoro.instructions: Build the Pomodoro project from the FCC frontend curriculum as an android app.

frisbys.name: Professor Frisby's Mostly Adequate Guide to Functional Programming
frisbys.description: In this lesson learn about Functional Programming using the most popular Functional Programming language - Javascript.

testing.name: Software Testing
testing.description: Software testing is key to application quality. In this lesson learn how to test the apps you create so they fail before, rather than after release.

debugging.name: Software Debugging
debugging.description: Learn a systematic process to debugging your applications and the tools that will help you automate the process of cleaning your code.

clonenetflix.name: Clone the Netflix Interface
clonenetflix.description: Put your frontend webdev skills to the test by using a frontend library to recreate a sophisticated user interface.
clonenetflix.instructions: Clone the Netflix interface using React, Angular, or Vue - pulling data from the Movie DB API or an API in a backend you create yourself.

calculus2.name: Calculus Two: Sequences and Series
calculus2.description: Gain an understanding of sequences, infinite series, convergence tests, and Taylor series.

classicpuzzles2.name: Complete all Classic Puzzles - Medium on CodinGame in JavaScript
classicpuzzles2.description: Improve your Javascript skills by completing the Medium level puzzles in this lesson.

softwarearch.name: Software Architecture & Design
softwarearch.description: Learn the principles and concepts involved in the analysis and design of large software systems using Unified Modeling Langual (UML) and the principles behind of sound software design and architecture.

codejam15r1a.name: Google Code Jam Round 1A - 2015
codejam15r1a.description: Practice your Javascript and analytical skills by completing these challenges.
codejam15r1a.instructions: Complete all challenges from the Code Jam Round 1A 2015

jsspessore.name: Programming Javascript Applications
jsspessore.description: Refine your Javascript knowledge by learning about closures, functional programming, and prototypal inheritance.

cloneblog.name: Clone this blog template
cloneblog.instructions: Clone all pages of this blog template

databases.name: Databases
databases.description: This set of mini-courses provides an understanding of fundamental database technologies including Relational, Structured Query Language (SQL), and semi-structure data structures such as XML and JSON.

agile.name: Agile Software Development
agile.description: Learn the principles of the Agile software methodology to help you gain synergy across your team to efficiently develop high quality applications.

es6katas.name: Complete ES6 Katas
es6katas.description: Show off your ES6 skills by completing a series of coding challenges
es6katas.instructions: Complete all coding challenges on this site using Javascript ES6.

cloudcomputing.name: Introduction to Cloud Computing
cloudcomputing.description: Learn the fundamentals of building and managing cloud technologies.

codejam15r1b.name: Google Code Jam Round 1B - 2015
codejam15r1b.description: Complete all challenges from the Code Jam Round 1B 2015

buildfacebook.name: Build FaceBook Clone
buildfacebook.description: Demonstrate your fullstack webdev capabilities by creating a Facebook clone.
buildfacebook.instructions: Build FaceBook: yes, all the functionality. See here for a list of requirements you should fullfill.

theoreticalcs.name: Intro to Theoretical Computer Science
theoreticalcs.description: In this course you'll learn about advanced computer science techniques and algorithms such as NP-completeness. These are the tools you can use in your apps to solve the hard problems.

codejam15r1c.name: Google Code Jam Round 1C - 2015
codejam15r1c.description: Complete all challenges from the Code Jam Round 1C 2015

probability.name: Introduction to Probability - The Science of Uncertainty
probability.description: Understanding probability is integral to many problems you'll be asked to solve as an application developer. In this course you'll gain an understanding of probability and its application to real world problems.

12colgrid.name: CSS Grid Layout
12colgrid.description: Demonstrate advanced CSS skills by implementing a complex grid
12colgrid.instructions: Write the CSS Necessary to create your own 12 column based grid layout - see here for an example

linearalgebra.name: Linear Algebra - Foundations to Frontiers
linearalgebra.description: Learn about the more advanced mathematical concepts of linear transformations, matrices, and systems of linear equations and their application to real world problems.

classicpuzzles3.name: Complete all Classic Puzzles - Easy
classicpuzzles3.description: Complete the Hard level Classic Puzzles
classicpuzzles3.instructions: Solve all the hard-level puzzles on CodinGame using JavaScript

crypto1.name: Cryptography I
crypto1.description: Encryption is one of the basic techniques used to protect information systems. In this lesson you'll gain an understanding of what cryptography is and the fundamental crypto algorithms used in modern applications.

codejam15r2.name: Google Code Jam Round 2 - 2015
codejam15r2.description: Complete all challenges from the Code Jam Round 2 2015

crypto2.name: Cryptography II
crypto2.description: Building on Cryptography I this lesson provides you with the information and techniques to implement cryptography in your applications.

clonetwitter.name: Build Twitter Clone
clonetwitter.description: Demonstrate your fullstack webdev capabilities by creating a Twitter clone.
clonetwitter.instructions: Build Twitter: yes, all the functionality. See here for a list of requirements you should fullfill.

computerarch.name: Computer Architecture
computerarch.description: Learn about the architecture of modern microprocessors.

codejam15r3.name: Google Code Jam Round 3 - 2015
codejam15r3.description: Complete all challenges from the Code Jam Round 3 2015

cybersecurity.name: Introduction to Cyber Security
cybersecurity.description: Understanding cyber security is a requirement for all application developers. Learn the concepts that will help you create apps that are secure and dependable.

classicpuzzles4.name: Complete all Classic Puzzles - Very Hard
classicpuzzles4.description: Complete the Hard level Classic Puzzles
classicpuzzles4.instructions: Solve all the very hard-level puzzles on CodinGame using JavaScript

computergfx.name: Computer Graphics
computergfx.description: Learn the concepts of computer graphics including realistic ray tracing.

ai.name: Artificial Intelligence
ai.description: Learn the fundamentals of Artifical Intelligence and how to apply them.

codejam15f.name: Google Code Jam World Finals - 2015
codejam15f.description: Complete all challenges from the Code Jam World Finals 2015

machinelearning.name: Machine Learning
machinelearning.description: In this lesson learn about Machine Learning, the science of making computers act without explict programming.

webgame.name: Create a Web-based Game
webgame.description: Demonstrate the skills of an professional fullstack web dev by creating a game of your own design
webgame.instructions: Design, implement, test, and deploy a game that is playable on the web, using the technologies of your choice. The only criteria are that it be playable online, and that it inculde a substantial AI component.

compilers.name: Compilers
compilers.description: Compling and translating abstract computer languages into executable programs is something all app developers use and depend on daily. Learn the concepts behind these processes and techniques.

nlp.name: Introduction to Natural Language Processing
nlp.description: Learn about Computational Linguistics and Natural Language processing. Then practice what you learn with challenging programming exercises.

cloneharmony.name: Clone Learn Harmony
cloneharmony.description: Demonstrate your fullstack webdev capabilities by creating a Learn Harmony clone.
cloneharmony.instructions: Build a Learn Harmony clone with all the functionality.

networks.name: Computer Networks
networks.description: Applications depend on computer networks and especially the Internet. Learn more about this fundamental building block in this lesson.

parallel.name: Parallel Computer Architecture and Programming
parallel.description: Multicore CPU & GPU architectures are ubiqutous in devices from the smallest smartphone to the largest scientific computing platforms. Learn about these hardware architectures and the techniques of parallel processing in this lesson.

codejam15dist.name: Distributed Google Code Jam - 2015
codejam15dist.description: Exercise your knowledge of distributed applications.
codejam15dist.instructions: Complete all problems from Distributed Google Code Jam 2015

cloneslack.name: Clone Slack
cloneslack.description: Demonstrate your fullstack webdev capabilities by creating a Slack clone.
cloneslack.instructions: Build a Slack clone the functionality should be complete to the point that one user can create a room, invite other users, and all users of that room can real-time chat. The room should be secure and inaccessible to anyone but those invited..

bootstrapfull.name: Create an NPM Module
bootstrapfull.description: Demonstrate your expertise and contribute to Open Source by creating an NPM module
bootstrapfull.instructions: Create an npm module that bootstraps a fullstack application, with Node.js on the backend, and the SPA library/framework of your choice on the frontend. Include a full test suite and comprehensive build processes. Publish it to NPM.

codejam16.name: Google Code Jam - 2016
codejam16.description: Complete all challenges from the Code Jam - 2016
codejam16.instructions: Complete all problems from all rounds

materialdesign.name: Extend your CSS grid framework
materialdesign.description: Enhance your CSS grid by upgrading it to follow Material Design principles
materialdesign.instructions: Extend your CSS grid framework to include the CSS and JavaScript required to implement 5 to 10 material design components

clonewebpage.name: Clone CodePen
clonewebpage.description: Demonstrate your fullstack webdev capabilities by creating a CodePen clone.

clonetributepage.name: Clone this Tribute Page
clonetributepage.description: Test your CSS skills by cloning this complex tribute page.
clonetributepage.instructions: Clone this Tribute Page with a topic of your choosing

cloneresume.name: Clone Online Resume
cloneresume.description: Test your advanced HTML and CSS knowledge by cloning an Online Resume

introbootstrap.name: Introduction to Bootstrap
introbootstrap.description: Learn how to use the Bootstrap Library for styling your webpages

qwbootstrap.name: Quentin Watt Bootstrap Video Series
qwbootstrap.description: Get a deeper understanding of Bootstrap's capabilities and usage

bootstraptribute.name: Bootstrap-ify your Tribute Page
bootstraptribute.description: Demonstrate your knowledge of the Bootstrap library by modifying your Tribute Page to use this library
bootstraptribute.instructions: Modify your tribute page to use Bootstrap instead of native CSS

foundationcrash.name: Foundation Framework Crash Course
foundationcrash.description: Learn the basics of the Framework library for styling your webpages

introsass.name: Introduction to Sass
introsass.description: Learn the basics of the Sass library for styling your webpages

introless.name: Introduction to Less
introless.description: Learn the basics of the Less library for styling your webpages

introstylus.name: Introduction to Stylus
introstylus.description: Learn the basics of the Stylus library for styling your webpages

howinternetworks.name: How the Internet Works
howinternetworks.description: Gain insight into the hardware and software that are the backbone of the Internet.

howwebworks.name: How the Web Works
howwebworks.description: Gain insight into the software and protocols that make up the how the World Wide Web (www).

getstartedweb.name: Getting Started with the Web
getstartedweb.description: Getting started with the Web is a concise series introducing you to the practicalities of web development. You'll set up the tools you need to construct a simple webpage and publish your own simple code.

setupwwwfolder.name: Setup Your Project Folder
setupwwwfolder.description: Learn what you should be aware of when setting up your project so you can set up a sensible file structure for your website. (Note: please skip the Javascript portion of this walkthrough for now).

redux01.name: Redux: The Single Immutable State Tree
redux01.description: Understand the problem Redux is trying to solve and how it differs from other libraries with the same goal

redux02.name: Redux: Describing State Changes with Actions
redux02.description: Dive deeper into state changes by learning how to describe them using Redux Actions.

redux03.name: Redux: Pure and Impure Functions
redux03.description: Understand a bit more about the types of functions you'll be creating to make good use of Redux.

redux04.name: Redux: The Reducer Function
redux04.description: Reducers are functions you create to operate on state changes. In this lesson learn about the power and flexibility they can bring to your apps.

redux05.name: Redux: Writing a Counter Reducer with Tests
redux05.description: See Redux in action with this example of a counter implemented using Redux actions and reducers.

redux06.name: Redux: Store Methods: getState(), dispatch(), and subscribe()
redux06.description: Understand the fundamentals of the Redux Store and how you can interact with it to share data across your app.

redux07.name: Redux: Implementing Store from Scratch
redux07.description: Learn how to implement and interact with the Redux Store

redux08.name: Redux: React Counter Example
redux08.description: See how React and Redux can be used.

redux09.name: Redux: Avoiding Array Mutations with concat(), slice(), and ...spread
redux09.description: Learn how to avoid array mutations by using concat(), slice(), and the spread operator.

redux10.name: Redux: Avoiding Object Mutations with Object.assign() and ...spread
redux10.description: Learn how to avoid object mutations by using Object.assign() and the spread operator.

redux11.name: Redux: Writing a ToDo List Reducer (Adding a ToDo)
redux11.description: Learn how more complex applications can take advantage of Redux via this ToDo app example.

redux12.name: Redux: Writing a ToDo List Reducer (Toggling a ToDo)
redux12.description: Continue learning about how an app can use Redux with this example showing how to toggle a todo item in the ToDo app.

redux13.name: Redux: Reducer Composition with Arrays
redux13.description: Learn the pattern for updating arrays through reducer composition.

redux14.name: Redux: Reducer Composition with Objects
redux14.description: Learn how to updating object properties through this reducer composition pattern.

redux15.name: Redux: Reducer Composition with combineReducers()
redux15.description: Learn how to use the combineReducer() function to create a new reducer from several that already exist.

redux16.name: Redux: Implementing combineReducers() from Scratch
redux16.description: Gain an understanding of the combineReducers() function by seeing how it is written.

redux17.name: Redux: React Todo List Example (Adding a Todo)
redux17.description: Extend your Redux knowledge by seeing how to implement a feature to add a new ToDo.

redux18.name: Redux: React Todo List Example (Toggling a Todo)
redux18.description: Continue your Reduct journey by seeing how to implement a feature to toggle a ToDo.

redux19.name: Redux: React Todo List Example (Filtering Todos)
redux19.description: Now see how Redux reducers can be used to filter a list of todo items.

redux20.name: Redux: Extracting Presentational Components (Todo, TodoList)
redux20.description: Learn how to separate behavior and appearance in an app to make it more maintainable.

redux21.name: Redux: Extracting Presentational Components (AddTodo, Footer, FilterLink)
redux21.description: Continue learning about the separatation of behavior and appearance in an app.

redux22.name: Extracting Container Components (FilterLink)
redux22.description: Learn how to avoid the unnecessary passing of props to intermediate components.

redux23.name: Redux: Extracting Container Components (VisibleTodoList, AddTodo)
redux23.description: Learn more about how to avoid the unnecessary passing of props to intermediate components.

redux24.name: Redux: Passing the Store Down Explicitly via Props
redux24.description: Learn how explicitly pass the store as a prop to your apps components.

redux25.name: Redux: Passing the Store Down Implicitly via Context
redux25.description: Learn how use React context to pass the store to all of your apps components.

redux26.name: Redux: Passing the Store Down with <Provider> from React Redux
redux26.description: Learn how use the React Redux <Provider> to pass the store to your apps components.

redux27.name: Redux: Generating Containers with connect() from React Redux (VisibleTodoList)
redux27.description: Learn how use the React Redux connect() function to generate your apps containers.

redux28.name: Redux: Generating Containers with connect() from React Redux (AddTodo)
redux28.description: Learn how use the Redux dispatch() function as a prop into React component.

redux29.name: Redux: Generating Containers with connect() from React Redux (FooterLink)
redux29.description: Discover how to use a containers props within the mapStateToProps() and mapDispatchToProps() functions.

redux30.name: Redux: Extracting Action Creators
redux30.description: Learn how to extract a components action creators to make your application maintainable.

reactbasics01.name: What Is React?
reactbasics01.description: Learn what ReactJS is, how it excels as JS frontend technology, and how you can use it in your applications.

reactbasics02.name: Setup Workspace with Webpack
reactbasics02.description: Dive into the ReactJS workspace structure and walkthrough the steps to create one.

reactbasics03.name: Set up Git
reactbasics03.description: Learn how to set up a local Git repository for your ReactJS applications

reactbasics04.name: First Component
reactbasics04.description: Learn about React Components, how they interact with the DOM, and how to create one.

reactbasics05.name: Multiple Components
reactbasics05.description: Discover how to use multiple components, including nested components, in your apps.

reactbasics06.name: Outputting Dynamic Data
reactbasics06.description: Discover how to create webpages containing not just static, but also dynamic data.

reactbasics07.name: Passing Data with Props
reactbasics07.description: Learn all about props and how you can use them to pass data to components.

reactbasics08.name: Events and ReactJS
reactbasics08.description: Learn how your app can interact with users through events.

reactbasics09.name: State of Components
reactbasics09.description: Learn how to manipulate state to control when a component is rendered in the DOM.

reactbasics10.name: How Does ReactJS Update the DOM?
reactbasics10.description: This lesson explains the ReactJS lifecycle and how and when elements in the DOM are updated.

reactbasics11.name: Stateless Components
reactbasics11.description: State is great, but not every component needs it. In this lesson learn all about stateless components.

reactbasics12.name: Communicating between Parent and Child Component
reactbasics12.instructions: Learn how parent and child components in your apps can communicate with one another.

reactbasics13.name: Passing Data Between Parent & Child Components
reactbasics13.description: Learn how parent and child components can communicate with one another by passing data.

reactbasics14.name: Two-Way Binding
reactbasics14.description: Learn all about two-way binding and how to effectively utilize it in this lesson.

reactbasics15.name: Component Lifecycle
reactbasics15.description: Learn about the lifecycle of ReactJS components - from creation to unmounting.

reactbasics16.name: React Router Setup
reactbasics16.description: In this lesson you'll learn how to create, manage, and use routes in your apps.

reactbasics17.name: React Router - Navigation & Parameters
reactbasics17.description: Learn more about React Router and how it can be an integral part of your single page applications.
